heisig_chinese_memo: If you work from sun up to sun down you will be prosperous.
heisig_story: What we mentioned in the previous two frames about 3 of something meaning "everywhere" or "heaps of" was not meant to be taken lightly. In this kanji we see two suns, one atop the other, which, if we are not careful, is easily confused in memory with the three suns of sparkle. Focus on the number this way: since we speak of prosperous times as sunny, what could be more prosperous than a sky with two suns in it? Just be sure to actually SEE them there.
koohiiStory1: If you work from Sun UP to Sun DOWN you will be prosperous.
koohiiStory2: I kept getting this mixed up with meanings like Â´fortuneÂ´, so here is a fool proof story! Remember the Vulcan salute from Â´Star TrekÂ´ (a fiction of the sci-fi genre in which heavenly bodies such as SUNS play a huge role) used with the phrase Â´live long and PROSPERÂ´? If thatÂ´s not enough of a visual reminder, the Vulcan salute shows the fingers parted in to 2 sets of 2, and visually kind of looks like this kanji if you think about it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The sun is the reason why crops grow and people can get out of bed in the morning. But on planets with two suns, they can get even more done and it makes them way more prosperous than us. They work all day, then as the first sun sets, the second one rises and they get a new burst of energy. The whole planet lives in a state of prosperity because of the two suns.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the prosperous planet that has two suns. They get so much work done that no one is ever hungry or tired or without.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The person on this planet with two suns who benefits from the prosperity the most is the Shougun (ã—ã‚‡ã†). Yes, this planet still has a shougun as their leader, but everything is going so well that they didn't see a need to change. The shogun will be in charge of this prosperous world forever. No one ever thinks of revolt when everyone has everything they could ever need.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the Shougun looking over the prosperous world, the two suns at his back.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: when two suns (æ—¥) are shining you'll be prosperous
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you work from sun up to sun down you will be prosperous.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jinwen from " day " from " mouth ", which means that the dawn of dawn, sing to announce dawn, wake up everyone. The ancients lacked material, so they mostly relied on the sun for warmth. In the morning, the sun broke through the darkness, and the light and warmth made it easy for people to cheer and cheer unconsciously (see Wang Xiantang "Zhou Changping Kao"). This is consistent with ordinary people's preference for sunny days more than cloudy days. Therefore, the word " chang " will call everyone to get up and work when the sun just came out. Most of these calls have a certain tone and are a source of singing. " Chang " is the first text of " singing " (Qiu Xigui <said Word Notes>). The original meaning is to shout and shout. The original meaning of the word " chang " is to call at sunrise, which is similar to the word "å" (indicating one's name in the dark night), see "å".

In the Spring and Autumn Period and Warring States period, there are many variations, or the "æ—¥" form is placed in the " mouth ", and the " kou " form is changed to "ç”˜" and "æ—¥". The small seal of "Shu Wen" is changed from "æ—¥" to " " Yue ", and the "Suowen" Yanwen still retains the " kou " form.

Oracle is used as a sacrifice name. The inscriptions on gold mean prosperity and prosperity, and Cai Hou Shenpan: "The descendants of Fanchang."

The bamboo slips are pronounced " sing " to express praise, "Yinqueshan Hanjian. Yanzi. "16": "Public shooting, quality, Tang Shangchang (singing) â–¡". The handed down "Yanzi Chunqiu. Outer Chapter Eight. "Yanzi's death, Jinggong's cry is called Mo Fu Chen told me to pass" "Public shooting, good quality, singing in the hall, if you have a mouthful." It means that Jinggong shot an arrow and the arrow missed the target. The doctors also praised him for shooting. Good (Sun Yanlin, Zhou Min, Miao Ruosu). It is also pronounced " advocate ", which means to advocate and promote, "Guodianjian. Jane 30: "Ancient (so) adults do not prosper (advocate) flow [words]", handed down "Book of Rites. "Mao Yi" is written as "So adults do not advocate loitering."

"Said Wen": "Chang, beautiful words. Cong Ri Cong said. One said: Sunlight. "Poetry" said: "Eastern Prosperity". ğ£…Š, Yan Wenchang."
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jinwen starts from the " day " from the " mouth ". It will call everyone to get up and work when the sun just comes out. Most of these calls have a certain tone and are a source of singing. " Chang " is " Chu Wen (Qiu Xigui) of " Sing ". The original meaning is to shout and shout.

Radicals: æ—¥  (sun)
Meaning Mnemonic
The sun is the reason why crops grow and people can get out of bed in the morning. But on planets with two suns, they can get even more done and it makes them way more prosperous than us. They work all day, then as the first sun sets, the second one rises and they get a new burst of energy. The whole planet lives in a state of prosperity because of the two suns.
Picture the prosperous planet that has two suns. They get so much work done that no one is ever hungry or tired or without.
Reading Mnemonic
The person on this planet with two suns who benefits from the prosperity the most is the Shougun (ã—ã‚‡ã†). Yes, this planet still has a shougun as their leader, but everything is going so well that they didn't see a need to change. The shogun will be in charge of this prosperous world forever. No one ever thinks of revolt when everyone has everything they could ever need.
Picture the Shougun looking over the prosperous world, the two suns at his back.
